Posts.Content: miricurt538 wrote: Ten days ago I had a US guided core needle biopsy which proved that my apprehensions were unnecessary.  I was treated with such kindness and respect!  I was told by the rediologist that the result should be sent to my doctor in two days which was on a Friday.  Late on Friday I called the office and was told the doctor and staff wasn't in and no one else there could help me.  Made it through the weekend very stressed and waited for the call on Momday.  Nothing,  On Tuesday I called and the person checked my records and saw no sign of the results.  On Wed. called and spoke to my doctors nurse and she said it wasn't in.  Called back yesterday, Thursday, and left message on her voice mail to please call me if it was or wasn't in.  Nothing.  Now it's Friday, heading into another weekend, and I haven't heard from them.  I'm so stressed that I'm sure my high blood pressure is soaring.  Is ten days an unusualy long time to wait.  I feel sure the biopsy isn't sent out of town, Dx 11/21/2011, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 dragonfly55

Posts.Content: miricurt538 wrote: After having the long wait for the biopsy, which was unnecessary--the wait not the biop..,I am seeing the surgeon to rap with him about cutting the lesions out  and seeing if the pathologist is right in how far the atypical cells have proceded.I'll be going alone and I hope I will hold it together.  My husband has been real nice about it but if I speak of mastectomy he says I wont have to make that choice and wont talk about it or listen to me.  I guess he's just scared.  Someone else on here mentioned how if she mentioned a worry to her husband he wanted to fix it and if he couldn't he got frustrated.  I think most men are like that--if we just want to vent about something they think we want them to "fix it."And heaven knows they can't fix us now.!  I hope all of you who havent gotten your biopsy reports yet will get them this week and they will be b9.  May all of you be blessed.!            MIRI Dx 11/21/2011, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 2, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: need lumpectomy after biopsy that didn't confirm a diagnosis. miricurt538 redsox

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2011 04:53PM miricurt538 wrote: Thanks to you wonderful, caring women; Crissy,  AnnNYC, andMaria.  I was really feeling down when I posted the above.  I have decided that there is just a lot of waiting when it comes with dealing with bc!  I have had the lumpectomy and the dr. called me in a couple of days with the results.  Well it wasn't complete.  Had to get the hormone status later.  Anyway, it was DCIS, stage 0, grade 2,er+ and pr+.  About as good as it gets.  Sometimes I feel guilty about getting emotional about it when so many women are going through so much worse.  But I guess when we come face to face with cancer we automatically think of the power it can have.  I know I am very lucky.  I know what you mean, Ann, when people tell you that you will be fine.  You want to believe that too, but know they don't know and you are sorta scared to think that positive because if it isn't fine, you want to be sorta prepared for it!!  Not sure that makes sense.  I go see the oncologist the 8th(more waiting) and will see whats next.  I plan to ask my husband to go with me.  I want him to be more involved in this process.  I really need him to. Thanks again, I am so glad I found this board. It can be a sanity saver. Good luch and a big squeeze(well, maybe not a squeeze,lol) miri
Posts.Title: need lumpectomy after biopsy that didn't confirm a diagnosis. miricurt538 redsox

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2011 03:48PM miricurt538 wrote: to all----any suggestions on how I can go about changing this to a more appropriate topic but still carry the thread on with the people I have met.  Thanking you!

Posts.Content: Dec 16, 2011 03:08AM miricurt538 wrote: I saw the radiation oncologist yesterday and he made me feel more assured about radiation.  I asked him if he knew about the new report out about the OncotypeDX for DCIS.  He knew about it but had only read the original release.  When I told him what I had found out he was willing to let me wait till the middle of January before starting radiation so I would have a chance for the testing.  He even called the medical onc. office to have them order it.  But I knew it would be the 28th of Dec. before they put up a web site for the drs to use for it.  I called Genomic Health, the company that researched the tests and they are not going to be accepting any orders for it till the 28th.  So I still probably wont be able to wait that long before starting rads.  bummer
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2011 03:04AM miricurt538 wrote: Kaara, I googled 3D Conformal and there was quite a bit came up.  You would probable have to seek out a place that is doing it.  I'm sure my hospital doesn't do it.  They have sent my order to the pathologist to send off to do the Oncetype DX test.  The MO's nurse said she believed there was a good chance of getting it back by the middle of Jan which was as long as the Rad Oncologist thought I should wait.  I hope it is the right thing to do.

DUH.  That's what I'll  try Monday if my PCP doesn't get it.

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2011 11:28PM miricurt538 wrote: Kaara:  I see where you have been three mos. trying to get a diagnosis.  I feel so for you.  And yes there is someone 71 on this site----I had my 71st. birthday today.  I sometimes think that the world thinks life ends at 65.  Most articles aimed at older people are for people up to 54 or 64!  wth!  We still have a lot of life left in us---even if we have to fight for it!  I hope you soon have some luck with them finding your "suspicious" spot so you can get on with it!

Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2011 08:09PM miricurt538 wrote: Well, I hope everyone is having a fine day.  I called my doctor's office earlier and talked to his nurse.  She said they still hadn't heard anything.  Now this is why I understand why they suggest u take someone with u to the consultation with your doctor------she said he( I think it was him)  had talked with someone (I don't remember whom) and they said the report wasn't ready yet( I think that's what they said)!! lol  Brain must have gone completely away!! Anyway he left her a note this morning telling her to call me and arrange an appointment for me to discuss my biopsy.  I feel she may not know for sure but knows more than she wanted to say.  I didn't realize this until I got off the phone and then it hit me.  So I have an appointment tomorrow at 11 am and I'm really scared now.  Can't really say that to anyone else and feel like I maybe shouldn't be jumping to conclusions but I am.
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2011 11:40PM miricurt538 wrote: Also Kaara:  You may have found the answer to this by now, but the radiologist did my biopsy and I was very nervous about it.  They changed from stereoptic to us guided biopsy(calling me to ask me if it was alright).  I was told then to ask for a sedative if I was nervous.  I did and it helped tremendiously.  I'm not one to suffer just for the sake of suffering!  It was practically painless,  nothing near as bad as going to the dentist and the radiologist and tech were so very nice.  It was almost enjoyable to be treated so royally.lol  No, they didn't give me that much sedation!!
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Dec 9, 2011 01:55AM miricurt538 wrote: Since I hadn't posted anything on here recently I thought I should maybe mention where I stand now in case someone checked.  I saw the oncologist today and liked her.  But she seemed unawarw of the study that came out this week from the convention in Houston.  It was on Oncotype DX showing who with DCIS did not need radiation therapy.  It said that this test showed that 75% of women did not need to have Rads.  But she started telling me that this was about some women not needing chemo and how this didn't pertain to me since I, with DCIS, wasn't considered for chemo anyway.  And I, not having many brain cells working since I first heard the word cancer, went along with it, thinking "how could I have been so mistaken.  It wasn't until I got home it hit me.  I thought, "I was right!  The doctor was wrong!  This study was about RADIATION.  and DCIS."  I would liked to have discussed this with her.  But wouldn't you have thyought an oncologist would have been aware of this study.  It was on national news and was big in the world of breast cancer.
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2011 05:48AM miricurt538 wrote: I meet with the Radiation Oncologist tomorrow.  I will ask him what his feelings are about it.  I would really like to get tested for it and see if radiation is not for me.  I wont mind taking it near as much if it is going to do me some good but getting blasted with rediation that can burn and cause cancer in itself when I don;t need it is not my idea of helping myself.  I know insurance and Medicare pays    for it when testing to see if chemo will help someone but I don't know if they will pay for it to check DCIS yet.  The company wont be posting the numbers for the doctors to match up for decision until Dec. 28.  Please pray that I will get the right decision made for me.Wishing the best for each of you.
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 9, 2011 05:48PM miricurt538 wrote: i've written 2 posts and they dissappeared on submission so I'll try one more time!  They still hadn't received my biopsy results at time of dr visit yesterday but had found it on the hospital files in the computer.  Dr didn't know I had been calling every day to hear something.  He hadn't been told!  He was quite upset when he learned I had been waiting for two weeks.( He hadn't known when my biopsy was scheduled for) He would have run it down much sooner.  It was ready the next day after it was taken out!  He said he was going to look into it.  Anyway, I was quite relieved with the outcome which was much better than I had come to expect.  The larger lesion (which is quite small) is ADH and found to be focally suspicious for intraductal papilliary carcinoma.  The lesser on is same without  the latter suspicious appearence.  I see surgeon on Mon. and make arrangments for complete excision of lesions and for biopsy.  So I want know until after surgery if I have to have follow up treatment.  I never thought that I could feel such relief on learning I might have what looked like early cancer! lol But I sleep through the night for the first time since this began and feel so refreshed this morning.  IDK, I may feel different later, but right now I am feeling as though I have a reprieve.  I hope all of you who are waiting for a biopsy diagnosis will have one at least as favorable as mine.  (of course Bnine would be preferred.  And again thank all of you who have supported and encouraged me through this.  It has meant the world to me. God bless u and help u in your travel to health. I'm not going anywhere though.  I'm still going to need this forum and maybe I can be of help to someone else.
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 20, 2011 11:02PM miricurt538 wrote:
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 22, 2011 12:31AM miricurt538 wrote: kaara--Glad you had an easy time with the biopsy but sorry your DX wasn't clean.of cancer.  But as far as bc goes, it could be worse, couldn't it?  I guess you will find out what form of treatment when u go to your next appointment, want you?  Hoping it want take much to knock it out!!  The surgeon called this afternoon to tell me the lumpectomies had shown the one place was positive for DCIS and the other wasn't.  I pretty much knew from the earlier path report that was what it would be.  I have a post operative app. with him next week and they will talk to me about which oncologist, etc.  At this point they didn't have all the tests back.  Well, Sister, take a deep breath and hang on for this ride that we didn't even buy tickets for.  Thanks for your support very much.  Prayers for you   Miri
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 01:05AM miricurt538 wrote: Good advice, marie5890,  Why didn't I think of that?  Well, for one thing I haven't learned to make a link!  Don't wan't to learn right now. ha  I'll tell you why. My brain is stressed out and has turned to Jello!  My tv remote disappeared today and I got out a new, spare one.  I set out to program it to work with my tv.  It was already set so that it worked with everything but volume and mute.  I had programmed many of them.  I don't know how it is possible but now lowering the volume changes channels!!!and I can only play the tv through ch.3 on the cable box which isn't the way i do it.  So I want no part of technology right now. lol.  Thanks a million. So glad your tumor is benign.  I've never heard of it so I will be researching it.  Wishing you wellness.
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Nov 7, 2011 04:38PM - edited Nov 7, 2011 04:40PM by miricurt538 12 days now and who'se countin'?  ME!  I know a lot of people goes through this long wait for some reason but it really shouldn't be that way.  It is so stressful not to know if you are going to have to put your life on hold for an unknown length of time.  I have a feeling now that if I get a good report it will be a while before I can feel normal.  I thank you guys so much for the recommendations and support.I have looked forward every day to checking here to see if I have any new posts.  This is an amazing site and you are all amazing women.  I thank you from the bottom of my heart.  If I turn out to not have bs I will still be one of the Sisterhood forever!!!

Posts.Content: Nov 5, 2011 03:57AM miricurt538 wrote: I want to thank all you ladies who replied to my post.  It has made me feel better just knowing you care.  After reading what some of you Makes me a little ashamed of myself for getting so stressed out at this point.I'm going to gird myself for battle(if necessary) Monday and see what is the heck the matter!  @ Ann,  I hope you are breathing better (and peeing better).  I'm sorry you are having to experience this when you need all your strength recovering from surgery.  I am thankful I found this site and one would almost think, when reading all these posts, that bc must make women totally wonderful, caring angels!! But I guess most women have this enate quality and dealing with bc brings the caring, empathic feelings out.  Thankyou all.    Joyce

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2011 03:44PM miricurt538 wrote: Kaara  I am glad we have our diagnoses now.  I am surprised that our facts are so close--from age to diagnosis.  I don't know all of mine since it wasn't all in when I saw the surgeon.  A ca coordinator called me earlier this week.  She had the latest information and said it was HR +100%.  Ours seem about the same size.  I had another smaller lesion removed that they aren't worried about.  Dr didn't think it called for removal of any nodes since it was contained ---hope he is right about that.  I have an appointment Monday with the surgeon but I don't reakon that I'll be meeting with anyone else that day.  I figured they would make appoints that day with oncologist,etc.  I need to get me a list of questions  made up.  DD and family are here for Thanksgiving from Miss. which is where I'm from.  I live abour 100 miles from Ashville, near Bristol, Tn.  Can see Bristol Motor Speedway from front yard.  Hope you are having a Happy Thanksgiving because I Believe happiness and laughter are healing.  Good luck and my prayers are for you and a complete recovery.  Miri
Posts.Title: It's been ten days now miricurt538 miricurt538

Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2011 11:38AM miricurt538 wrote: So NatsFan, I take it to mean that you bypassed the rad.  I have been writhing with indecision since the news of the study came out in San Antonio about the Oncotype DX test showing that 75% of DCIS not needing rad.  i have been dx with DCIS, stage 0, 1.4cm, er+/pr+.  I think it is awful for one to have to go through that unnecessarily.  I am scheduled to see the  RO Wed. and plan to see what he says.  It is going to put me a little late for starting rad if the test shows I could benefit from it but it seems noone has been in a hurry to get me through the tests-appointments gauntlet quickly. SheChirple, I wish you luck in making the right choice.  This complete trip is wrought with indecision and frustration.  SORRY, I sound soooo sorry for myself. lol    Didn't mean to!  I know I have it so much easier than many!
Posts.Title: Is it really a grey zone? SheChirple Gia259995

Posts.Content: Nov 13, 2011 04:31PM - edited Nov 13, 2011 04:37PM by miricurt538 Helly Molly,  Waiting SUCKS!  I'm so sorry u are having to do it.  Hopefully you will hear tomorrow.  I had biopsy of 2 lesions on Oct. 26 and didn't hear until two weeks later and then my drs. office had to go looking for the results. I think I would have flipped out if it hadn't been for my facebook friends and these great, caring ladies here.  My biopsies were US guided Core Needle and they were unable to make a sure diagnosis of one so I am seeing a surgeon tomorrow to make plans for a (or maybe 2) lumpectomys.   there was atypical hyperplasia found and I was so happy with that because I had let my immagination run away with all the waiting.  If they find any cancer it will be early and small and lumpectomy should get it all.  I'm telling u all this to say to u yo not let it drag on for days.  I was calling my drs. office but they weren't telling him so he didn't know I had had it done and was waiting so long.  He would have done something.  So first of all,  If they have let this go this long they surely didn't think it was serious so try to think positive.  Those words are so easy to say!! But I'm sure you have read where 80% of biopsies are b9 (that's in the states tho).  If, after 3 or 4 business days u haven't heard from yours, start asking questions!  I was calling but I see now I should have called radiology and pathology and maybe Obama!!lol Good luck and prayers for you.  Let us know. Miri
Posts.Title: hating waiting molly70 BrilliantInCa

Posts.Content: Feb 23, 2012 09:35AM miricurt538 wrote: I had core needle biopsy on wed. and radiologist said my doctor should hear by Fri.  Called PCP office on Fri. Afternoon and staff had left. I wait all weekend and call Mon. morning---no results in.    Nurse said she'd call me just as soon as they heard.  Called on Wed ---it had now been a week, no results in yet.  This went on for two weeks.  The ladies here were encouraging me to go in person a stay until i got results!  Finally, after two weeks, I called and asked the Nurse for Rad. number so I could call them.  She called me back in a little while---she had run down the results and said the doctor wanted to see me next day.  When I went in and he found out how long I had been waiting, he couldn't believe it.  He hadn't know what day the biopsy had been scheduled for.  He was very upset and excused himself to go speak to the nurse.  By the way, he said he always gave the results in person regardless of the Dx.  So, if anyone has waited over a few days they should go in person and demand someone find out why the results are not in.  If someone had looked in the right place in the hospital computer, mine could have been found days and days earlier and saved me all that hellish waiting!!!
Posts.Title: How did you hear biopsy results--phone or appt? frazzledmom schoolmom

Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2011 11:17PM miricurt538 wrote: Kaara, have you gals been keeping up with the study out of San Antonio conforence about 75% of DCIS patients being able to not do rads?  I think , since I had lumpectomy before Thanksgiving my doctors may not want me to wait as long as it would take to get a test back.  Ya'll might benefit from looking into it.  I would want the doctor to explain the numbers to me though.  The per centages are greek to me cause there are so many different ways of looking at them.Most people think it will probably be a valuable tool to see which person with DCIS has a good chance of never having a recurrance of DCIS or invasive cancer.I seems to be another step forward.Dr. Susan Love seems empressed with it and she doesn't accept just any study or trial.  Good luck. Mon. Kaara with your lumpectomy.  I hope this is definitive enough and gets it all and you will be ready to do what you will do.  bGood luck to all.
Posts.Title: December 2011 Surgeries - want to wait together? CookieMonster Moonflwr912

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2012 11:58PM miricurt538 wrote: To:   Leaf      IMO, that is sufficient reason not to see a doctor again.  My results from core needle biopsy took two weeks because it got sidetracted somewhere and my doctors office didn't get it.  I was kept sane by the ladies on BCO.  When I asked a person in the surgeon's office when I would hear from the lump. result, she said he usually told patients when they came in for post op visit which was in 2 weeks!  I said "Un huh!  I wan't to know as soon as it comes in!"  The doctor called me himself, maybe the next day, and said it was DCIS.  Waiting sucks!!!!
Posts.Title: Anxiety sky high... how long for excisional biopsy results? shabby6485 FilterLady

Posts.Content: Jan 23, 2012 01:18AM miricurt538 wrote: Kaara;  I do hope the stars are in the right place for you this time and you get in on those trials.  Did you learn anymore about the treatments themselves?  Hoping for peace for you.
Posts.Title: Radiation Therapy for early stage Kaara mimikitty

Posts.Content: Jan 22, 2012 06:52PM miricurt538 wrote: Kaara, I'm happy you found a trial for EB-PBI.  Hope it has worked out for you.  I have been waiting since early December to hear from the Oncotype-DX for DCIS and the MO received it last week.  My score was 18 which is low risk (this score is different from the score for Chemo) and after discussing it with my MO I told her I wanted to forego rads.  I felt sure she wanted me to get it but at the time I felt sure that I was ok without it.  Then, guess what?  I came home and started second guessing myself.  I haven't found any trials for External Beam Partial Breast Irradiation anywhere near me.  I think I would do that if I could.  The hospital near me does Internal Partial Breast but I don't feel comfortable with that from what I've read.  I'm very torn.  It's hard to decide to have WBR now since I have the low score from Genomic Health.  I guess there is no east answer which is what I was looking for when I asked for the test.
Posts.Title: Radiation Therapy for early stage Kaara mimikitty
